vista.gui
Class SystemConsole

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      vista.gui.SystemConsole
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class SystemConsole
extends javax.swing.JFrame

A display area for console output. This component will display the output of a PrintStream, PrintWriter, or of a running process in a swing text component. The text from the output and error pipes to the child process can be displayed with whatever character attributes desired.

Version:
1.2 03/04/99
Author:
Timothy Prinzing
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

SystemConsole

public SystemConsole()
Create a console display. By default the text region is set to not be editable.

Method Detail

public java.io.PrintWriter createPrintWriter(javax.swing.text.AttributeSet a)
Create a PrintWriter that will display in the console using the given attributes.

getOutputArea

public javax.swing.text.JTextComponent getOutputArea()
Fetch the component used for the output. This allows further parsing of the output if desired, and allows things like mouse listeners to be attached. This can be useful for things like compiler output where clicking on an error warps another view to the location of the error.

setOutputAttributes

public void setOutputAttributes(javax.swing.text.AttributeSet a)
